cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 10 miles WSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, paralleling the North Carolina Outer Banks and then heading toward the Gulf of Maine and Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Hatteras, NC (brush/near-shore passage rather than an inland landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Nova Scotia (well north of North Carolina)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Surf City NC to NC/VA border; Storm Surge Warning Salter Path NC to Poquoson VA; Tropical Storm Warning NC/VA border to Fenwick Island DE and portions of Chesapeake & coastal New England
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and eastern North Carolina coast (including Cape Fear and Outer Banks) northward to Nova Scotia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with occasional stronger gusts likely through the morning of 6 Sep, diminishing by midday as Dorian accelerates northeastward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible (<3 ft) but the primary storm-surge threat has shifted north of Wilmington; surge warnings south of Salter Path have been discontinued.
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 3–6 inches of rain possible early 6 Sep, bringing storm-total rainfall locally over 4 inches and posing a flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado potential in outer rainbands; large swells and dangerous rip currents impacting vessel operations at harbor entrances.
